03_central_limit_theorem/02_normal/07_x_from_leftarea_v2

Random variable \(K\) is normally distributed with mean \(\mu = 79\) and standard deviation \(\sigma = 18\). \[K = \text{N}(79,\,18) \] Evaluate \(k\) such that \(P(K<k) = 0.19\). In other words, determine an upper boundary such that a normal spinner with mean 79 and standard deviation 18 lands under that boundary 19% of the time.
